caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 33.
Caecum heptagonum
. A–C . Profile views depicting sculpture variations (LACM 1976-7.15). D . Ventral view (SBMNH 452511). E . Holotype, NHMUK 1857.6.4.1524. F . Operculum, exterior surface (SBMNH 452511). G . Operculum, interior surface (SBMNH 452511).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Distribution and Habitat. From Magdalena Bay, Baja California , Mexico to Manabi , Ecuador , including Revillagigedo Islands and Cocos Island. Intertidal to
148 m .
Common subtidally on coarse sand substrates.

Remarks. The type of
Caecum heptagonum
is an anterior end fragment (NHMUK 1857.6.4.1524, Fig. 33E ).
Caecum heptagonum
is quite variable in the number of longitudinal ribs (6–12) and strength of the axial threads. Specimens with a higher number of ribs and strong axial threads may even appear to be a distinct species. Figured is an extreme example of a late subadult ( Fig. 33C ).
